yes Kevin, say python-cinderclient [1], python-heatclient [2],[3] etc.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/shell.py#L323-L339
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-heatclient/blob/master/heatclient/shell.py#L111-L124
[3] https://github.com/openstack/python-heatclient/blob/master/heatclient/shell.py#L153-L166'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-11 16:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-11 16:11:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Listing here the observations/findings for python-novaclient support for v3 authentication plugins:

Openstack can use different types of authentication plugins provided by the keystoneclient library. 
Token (Authentication with a token) and password (Authentication with a username and a password) are the default plugins available.
After these changes, one can use default plugins available.
Refer [1] here listed minimum required OpenStack environment variables.

To support other v3 plugins [2], we need to be update python-novaclient for 
1] Need to make changes similar to [3] to retrieve supported keystone version using the given auth url.

2] options which are not supported by python nova client, eg. v3adfspassword plugin requires additional parmeters like 
   --os-identity-provider
   --os-protocol
   --os-identity-provider-url
   --os-service-provider-endpoint
   --os-service-provider-entity-id

3] Currently keystone supports bydefult IDENTITY_API_VERSION as 3, so third party plugins (say rackspace-keystoneauth-plugin) need to be upgrade accordingly to use v3 implementation.

4] By default keystone supported _DEFAULT_AUTH_METHODS = ['external', 'password', 'token', 'oauth1', 'mapped', 'application_credential'], and need to update this list to support for v3kerberos and v3totp

5] Code is not generic, depending upon auth type, required parameters should be validated not the all.


[1] https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E78305_01/E78304/html/openstack-envars.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/authentication-plugins.html#v3-identity-plugins
[3] https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L423"}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-14 06:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-14 09:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-14 11:50:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Updating lower-constraints.txt for requests-mock version by referring [1] to resolve Zuul failure for 'requirements-check'

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/lower-constraints.txt"}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-14 11:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-06-14 12:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-15 06:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-06-15 06:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Modify novaclient to support basic attributes

Added support for parsing OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID, OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME,
OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID, and OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME options.

Change-Id: I9e1a3426f174c2e6d9f4f6bf10e9aecb62bad8d0
Closes-Bug: #1744118

commit_message:
[Stable Only] Initialise failed_builds in IronicNodeState

When we merged I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8 we introduced a
regression in the ironic host manager as it doesn't setup a
failed_builds attribute.  We didn't need to do this on master as the
host manager in question is already removed due to
I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575132/
Change-Id: Ia52dda42208398b4f719fa3023dd10d9642b1e02
Closes-Bug: 1776596
(cherry picked from commit d26dc0ca03e9cc9a04ac02d88ba2d2867340f5cd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 08:37:50.000000000', 'message': "Make @memoize thread-aware

If 2 parallel threads simultaneously make an expensive call to a
memoized function with arguments for which the returned value wasn's
cached before, 2 calls are effectively made in parallel.

It's better to avoid such a situation and if one thread already
initiated an expensive call, block on it in another thread and once
the call in the first thread is completed, unblock and reuse the value
which is cached now.

Co-Authored-By: Vladislav Kuzmin <vkuzmin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Id216e7b9c1bd836ee70a36ecb378e7d51d3821d2
(cherry picked from commit a72a1eca6e495fb033926f41369f7389e81a9f2d)
"}]
commit_message:
Make @memoize thread-aware

If 2 parallel threads simultaneously make an expensive call to a
memoized function with arguments for which the returned value wasn's
cached before, 2 calls are effectively made in parallel.

It's better to avoid such a situation and if one thread already
initiated an expensive call, block on it in another thread and once
the call in the first thread is completed, unblock and reuse the value
which is cached now.

Co-Authored-By: Vladislav Kuzmin <vkuzmin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Id216e7b9c1bd836ee70a36ecb378e7d51d3821d2
(cherry picked from commit a72a1eca6e495fb033926f41369f7389e81a9f2d)

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
Remove nova dependencies from test_resource_provider

Now, none of the tests in test_resource_provider.py require
anything from the nova base test class, so testtools.TestCase is
used instead.

Also, the request context provided by placement (intead of nova)
is more appropriate for these tests (and doesn't require a CONF)

Because the DatabasePoisonFixture is no longer present we no longer
need the mock in AllocationTest that guards against it.

Change-Id: I62d348e4551cce7a93337e32eb540574d8291bd2

commit_message:
When SG delete fails on vip deallocate, try harder

Go out and find the ports that are using the SG and remove them.

commit_message:
Move db using provider unit tests to functional

Some of the ResourceProvider unit tests used the db directly.

These have been moved to the functional test_resource_provider.py and
transformed as required to make them work in that setting. Some test
cases were appended to existing tests where it made sense.

The save_immutable test which claimed to use the db, but did not,
remains in the original file but in a more suitable test class.

Change-Id: I7a91ed797b052500fdd80690cb35f1049ef6c422

commit_message:
Adjust db using allocation unit tests

Some of the Allocation unit tests used the db directly.

Two were already duplicated by existing functional tests,
so were removed. test_create_with_id_fails doesn't need
the db if simplified and provided with some mocks for code
called but not used.

Change-Id: If1be243813079065e975a7d3983398e03df22a6d

commit_message:
Dynamic dependencies: remove unused variable

This PS removes an unused variable from the resolution of
dynamic pod dependencies.

Change-Id: I95728a7b91d5143c2a44566179ef8066727020af
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Add "hot_template_version" to dynamically support multiple
HOT template version

This patch adds "hot_template_version" in "metadata", that lets
users can choose which version of HOT template they want.

Change-Id: I45609f41a1e1e01acf73abf2fb65b2ecb7cb7e86

'}, {'created': '2018-06-16 21:37:32.000000000', 'message': 'Gotpl: remove quote and trunc to suppress output

This PS removes the use of the `quote and truncate` approach to

commit_message:
Gotpl: remove quote and trunc to suppress output

This PS removes the use of the `quote and truncate` approach to
suppress output from gotpl actions in templates and replaces it
with the recommended practice of defining `$_` instead.

Change-Id: I5fedc3471dcbecef37d2fe1302bf9760b3163467
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.test_deploy

The tests are very straightforward and do not require many of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

One missing tool from NoDBTestCase is self.flags, which helps manage
configuration. That is a facade over CONF.set_override, so we just call
that instead.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: Ice6a42b3b8b94e155d7332256e9b568f80bc663d

commit_message:
Make auth_encryption_key a secret

auth_encryption_key is used to encrypt autentication info in the
database, it must be a secret.

Change-Id: Ib15db2632d087b91ca4923a64fa9923daa6b2c85
(cherry picked from commit 24cbbd517a997a192619e89de28cfad60ea4f264)
(cherry picked from commit a21bdf6caeadc68bba39d6efdee23460f7a52b1a)

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.test_microversion

The tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: I05498a30646d8e718c700fcedff4657907062982

set only the needed and used adminurl variable

commit_message:
Add aggregate metadata unset support to nova_aggregate

Feature was waiting for python-openstackclient to add support
for the "openstack aggregate unset" command. This is now available in 2.4.0.

Closes-bug: #1776772
Change-Id: Id6ddd9d0a193819c9f69ea138554a2647bcd8ae3
(cherry picked from commit 4a4ac4a3cc038a7c3d5de934c54bc192e3474fdf)

[{'created': '2018-06-12 21:27:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix TestInterfaceWaiters

Solve tests methods unreliability when time.time() returns two floats
that rounded with int() method gives two different integers.

commit_message:
Fix TestInterfaceWaiters

TestInterfaceWaiters test case were not verifyinf the main waiters
functionality and sometime they could intermittently fail without
reason like seen in below openstack-tox-py27 Zuul check.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559069/33

Solve tests methods failure when time.time() returns two consecutive
floats that rounded by int() function is returning two different integers.

This patch also verify the condition verification method are properly
called and that waiters methods actually returns expected part of
returned body.

Change-Id: I0a2081d823b304d58a5a69a8965858bd4f1303a0

[{'created': '2018-06-11 19:31:16.000000000', 'message': "Do not use nova.test in placement.test_fault_wrap

The tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

By not using NoDBTestCase we lose a fixture that captures stderr output,
produced when the exception used by the tests is (intentionally) raised.
This adds slightly to the volume of output in test logs but is light
enough to not yet be a concern and adds some useful visibility.

We can explore adding such capturing back, as we create fixtures
specific to placement.

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.test_fault_wrap

The tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

By not using NoDBTestCase we lose a fixture that captures stderr output,
produced when the exception used by the tests is (intentionally) raised.
This adds slightly to the volume of output in test logs but is light
enough to not yet be a concern and adds some useful visibility.

We can explore adding such capturing back, as we create fixtures
specific to placement.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: Iba3455a7858badb34d4224429acb69273e6a88c4

commit_message:
Make auth_encryption_key a secret

auth_encryption_key is used to encrypt autentication info in the
database, it must be a secret.

Change-Id: Ib15db2632d087b91ca4923a64fa9923daa6b2c85
(cherry picked from commit 24cbbd517a997a192619e89de28cfad60ea4f264)

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.test_handler

These tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

Note that when placement is extracted, we'll need to create a local
uuidsentinel. That's easiest to do at the time of extraction.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: I2f859b25694cd4304a94effce07f0ffd648e9d4e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 14:30:49.000000000', 'message': "Reduce verbosity during mysql bootstrap, non-HA

During the initial deployment, a one-time container is used to bootstrap the
mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The
script that runs that is too verbose and logs some credentials in the
container's logs and in the journal.

Use kolla_extend_start directly instead of kolla_start to stop tracing shell
commands and reduce logging to the bare minimum for troubleshooting.

This is the non-HA counterpart of I90827feff0d1b9fd8badb72e68e4c8dd8db8aea5,
which is now also used to set up containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: Ib583fa92d279fc3166cceaf58e152b5cce315d44
Closes-Bug: #1765339
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce verbosity during mysql bootstrap, non-HA

During the initial deployment, a one-time container is used to bootstrap the
mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The
script that runs that is too verbose and logs some credentials in the
container's logs and in the journal.

Use kolla_extend_start directly instead of kolla_start to stop tracing shell
commands and reduce logging to the bare minimum for troubleshooting.

This is the non-HA counterpart of I90827feff0d1b9fd8badb72e68e4c8dd8db8aea5,
which is now also used to set up containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: Ib583fa92d279fc3166cceaf58e152b5cce315d44
Closes-Bug: #1765339

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.test_requestlog

The tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: Ib917601a61b896e7ed86e0cd189c442ffaf883b3

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-15 08:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-15 09:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

My some async action may take hours, but they will be failed after evaluator times. Because they leave mistral-executor in couple of seconds.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-15 11:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-15 13:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Not exactly sure what you mean by async actions. Are you on IRC?'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-15 14:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

 > 
 > https://docs.openstack.org/mistral/latest/contributor/asynchronous_actions.html

Ok, we figured out. Thanks for the link. It needs a little tweaking, but I have an idea. :)'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-16 08:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-16 11:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-16 11:40:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

The async action problem was solved in patch set 22. 

What happened is: By default the value of last_heartbeat is date.max. So the actions won't be closed unless an executor updates it's last_heartbeat field at lease once. It won't happen in case of async actions because the reporting is disabled for that action type.

Basically this means that this feature does't affect async actions any more."}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-16 13:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-17 08:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-18 10:39:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24: Code-Review-1

> The async action problem was solved in patch set 22.
 > 
 > What happened is: By default the value of last_heartbeat is
 > date.max. So the actions won't be closed unless an executor updates
 > it's last_heartbeat field at lease once. It won't happen in case of
 > async actions because the reporting is disabled for that action
 > type.
 > 
 > Basically this means that this feature does't affect async actions
 > any more.

I thought about slightly different approach.
If message between engine and executor will be lost that even sync actions stuck in RUNNING state.
What do you think if default value of last_heartbeat will be `utils.utc_now_sec()` but we will set datetime.max on async_action, for example:

     def _create_action_execution(self, input_dict, runtime_ctx,
                                 desc='', action_ex_id=None):
          .....
         if not self.is_sync(copy.deepcopy(input_dict)):
             values['last_heartbeat'] = datetime.datetime.max
           ....
          self.action_ex = db_api.create_action_execution(values)"}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-24 10:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Do you mean the situation when the the action execution is scheduled, but it is not yet picked up by any of the executors? 

It will remain in RUNNING state, it is true, but it is a better behavior because most probably the message is the queue, and will be picked up as soon as an executor is capable of receiving messages.

For example imagine that the engine scheduled an action execution, and it sits in the message queue because there is no available executor to process messages (for example because all of the executors are dead). It is not a wise decision to close the execution in that case, because when an executor becomes available, it will pick up the message and begins to process it. So the timeout should be considered from the beginning of execution rather than from the time when it was scheduled.

Did you mean this scenario, or did I misunderstand you?'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-25 10:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

> Do you mean the situation when the the action execution is
 > scheduled, but it is not yet picked up by any of the executors?
 > 
 > It will remain in RUNNING state, it is true, but it is a better
 > behavior because most probably the message is the queue, and will
 > be picked up as soon as an executor is capable of receiving
 > messages.
 > 
 > For example imagine that the engine scheduled an action execution,
 > and it sits in the message queue because there is no available
 > executor to process messages (for example because all of the
 > executors are dead). It is not a wise decision to close the
 > execution in that case, because when an executor becomes available,
 > it will pick up the message and begins to process it. So the
 > timeout should be considered from the beginning of execution rather
 > than from the time when it was scheduled.
 > 
 > Did you mean this scenario, or did I misunderstand you?

I want that we set a current time to the last_heartbeat filed and to create a action execution in one transaction.
Because what will be if a Mistral executor dies in the this line https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/mistral/tree/mistral/executors/executor_server.py?h=refs/changes/85/527085/24#n102 .
Message was not redelivered by rabbit and a action execution stuck in the RUNNING state.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Yes, I see your point. However, if we set the current time, we will face the issue what I described before. I think it is way more likely to happen and we should rather avoid that case.

What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-30 11:59:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Probably the best behavior would be to set the initial date to utc_now() + <a fixed delay, like 5 hours>. It would tolerate the situation when no executors are available until that fixed delay, and also the other case when the executor dies before sending the first heartbeat.

However, we would again have problem with async actions. It could be solved if the engine knew that whether the action execution is async or not. Maybe the is_async flag should be stored in the db as well. I will investigate this option.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-30 14:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:16:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

> It could be solved if the engine knew that whether the action execution is async or not. 

What's the problem?
For example:
     def _create_action_execution(self, input_dict, runtime_ctx,
                                 desc='', action_ex_id=None):
          .....
         if not self.is_sync(copy.deepcopy(input_dict)):
             values['last_heartbeat'] = datetime.datetime.max
           ....
          self.action_ex = db_api.create_action_execution(values)

> Maybe the is_async flag should be stored in the db as well. I will investigate this option.

It's a bad option. Because I guess the async flag can dependents from input value."}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-31 09:01:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

It is not necessary to set the last_heartbeat in this solution, because we exclude them from the evaluation. See the evaluator, it only queries sync action executions.

> It's a bad option. Because I guess the async flag can dependents from input value.

Yes, is_sync flag depends on the input, but the input of the action executions is fixed as far I know. Or did I miss something?"}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-05-31 09:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-31 09:43:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

> It is not necessary to set the last_heartbeat in this solution,
 > because we exclude them from the evaluation. See the evaluator, it
 > only queries sync action executions.
 > 
 > > It's a bad option. Because I guess the async flag can dependents
 > from input value.
 > 
 > Yes, is_sync flag depends on the input, but the input of the action
 > executions is fixed as far I know. Or did I miss something?

Oops. I missed your changes. I will take a look at them later."}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-06-01 06:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

(1 comment)

While I'm still going through review, can you please say a couple of words how this change affects performance? May be you have some rough numbers."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

The logical part looks good to me. I just have a little concern about how it affects performance. Some numbers would be useful. Most of my comments are related to naming and design clearness. Please address.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-06-01 08:09:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > While I'm still going through review, can you please say a couple
 > of words how this change affects performance? May be you have some
 > rough numbers.

Performance-wise the following should be considered:

1) Every time an action starts, it immediately sends a report.
2) The list of running actions is reported in every evaluation_interval by every executor.
3) The reports are handled as they are sent. Every report call is a transaction but a report can contain several updates.
4) Action Executions in the DB are updated one-by-one (I don't know of other way to do this)
5) The evaluation happens every `evaluation_interval` but the selection is optimized to return only the expired actions.

One problem I just realized: the evaluation is ran by all engines and there is no interlocking, so it may happen that more than one engine tries to take action on expired action executions. The solution may be to use the delayed call mechanism instead of simple threads.

In our tests we did not see serious impact on performance."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-06-01 08:25:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

Yes, Andras, the concern about overlapping of the threads is valid. Let's use Scheduler for that."}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-06-01 08:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

(6 comments)

Refactored the evaluator (also renamed it) to use the scheduler.'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-06-04 07:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-06-04 07:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-06-04 16:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23211, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

Could somebody have a look at the failing tests? I feel like my review has nothing to do with them.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-06-05 08:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

commit_message:
A mechanism to close stuck running action executions

If an executor dies while running an action execution, then the
execution will remain in RUNNING state (because the dead executor
can't signal the error).

Implements blueprint: action-execution-reporting

Change-Id: I51b4db6aa321d0e53bbb85a74f8ebaea0376d22e

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.handlers.test_aggregate

The tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the setup
and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the future
of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: I1520d6535e39048880b142495f5d6bf1d86f1803

commit_message:
standalone: switch default NeutronPublicInterface to br-ex

NeutronPublicInterface was set to eth1 but this interface doesn't exist
while br-ex does and is already used by the containerized undercloud.

Depends-On: I2289159d501f9c6793afa5f4a548cabea5062c00
Change-Id: I59869e4ca88634bed3be896c7a7182dc2cb34ce4

commit_message:
Rename Dell EMC XTREMIO iSCSI environment file

Rename the file in the environments directory so that the file name
matches the reference in capabilities-map.yaml.

Old name : cinder-dellemc-xtremio-config.yaml
New name : cinder-dellemc-xtremio-iscsi-config.yaml

The new name includes "iscsi" and that is consistent with the corresponding
Heat template file name (cinder-backend-dellemc-xtremio-iscsi.yaml).

Closes-Bug: #1772967
Change-Id: I29dac9578087f8696598d3da950905bfa7c2b32f
(cherry picked from commit ff1728f8336c14ca300af045eecb53b5eef5c515)

commit_message:
Gotpl: remove quote and trunc to suppress output

This PS removes the use of the `quote and truncate` approach to
suppress output from gotpl actions in templates and replaces it
with the recommended practice of defining `$_` instead.

Change-Id: I5f35c5f7e70b4f7f461d772e3b72ed1c695c56a8
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Do not use nova.test in placement.test_util

These tests are very straightforward and do not require any of the
setup and fixtures that nova.test.NoDBTestCase supplies. Also, in the
future of placement extraction we don't want the dependecy.

Note that when placement is extracted, we'll need to create a local
uuidsentinel. That's easiest to do at the time of extraction.

Partially implements blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: Ia18442d2afcaca51203104f790072eaa77b3bbac

commit_message:
Add osprofiler config options to generated reference

osprofiler is optional, but if it's installed we'll
load up the configuration options from the library,
but they weren't in the generated config sample so
people would have to find the osprofiler docs, or
worse the code, to figure out how to configure it.

This simply adds the osprofiler config options to the
nova config sample, which will also show up in the
config reference docs.

Change-Id: I28d35165ed77487cd49d560fb1eda4f1d640734e
Closes-Bug: #1774208

commit_message:
Fix retrying lower bound in requirements.txt

Due to change [1], the retrying package in requirements.txt
must match the lower bound found in lower-constraints.txt.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574367/

Change-Id: I05600e8c606099aea74aa032f92c4f44f947cb4c

commit_message:
Libvirt: add dynamic deps on neutron agents as option.

This PS adds the ability for the Libvirt chart to depend on
neutron agents being up if desired.

Change-Id: I7cd2dca4416d1852261591a0064381ae2b087b9a

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone to tripleo-multinode-container-full

It was only in tripleo-multinode-container-minimal so there is no reason
that we also run this job in tripleo-multinode-container-full so we can
test the CI job for other projects.

Change-Id: I2289159d501f9c6793afa5f4a548cabea5062c00

commit_message:
Fix ansible inventory clean up

Problem:
 + '[' 1 = 0
 quickstart.sh: line 496: [: missing `]'
 + '[' '' = 1 ']'
 + VERBOSITY=vv

To do an and you need -a instead of && in the same brackets expression

Closes-Bug: 1776897

Change-Id: I5ac593ba96b5184fe6fffa1632058b1011b60a23

commit_message:
Use InferenceRuleManager instead of RoleManager for implied roles

RoleManager methods for implied roles are deprecated. [0]

This also fixes `openstack implied role list` which was previously
broken due to a wrong method name. [1]

[0]. https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/c878196076852e11f95dc7af1a9d1e50be43eb27/keystoneclient/v3/roles.py#L392-L419
[1]. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2018-06-15.log.html#t2018-06-15T23:02:41

Change-Id: I7da0e639129efbacb65bbac99890526fa48016da

[{'created': '2018-04-07 01:17:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml

There is no default value for log_dirs in the os-log-dir-setup.yml
which means that any role that includes it without that value will
crash and burn.  We set a default here to protect us from breaking
roles in the future if we forget to specifiy log_dirs on baremetal.

Change-Id: I07bf9f4bce7bb53ecc305d260142e878797d6c04
Closes-Bug: #1761781
(cherry picked from commit e9eca74e8366667fd0c26e47368e1092fee4590a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml

There is no default value for log_dirs in the os-log-dir-setup.yml
which means that any role that includes it without that value will
crash and burn.  We set a default here to protect us from breaking
roles in the future if we forget to specifiy log_dirs on baremetal.

Change-Id: I07bf9f4bce7bb53ecc305d260142e878797d6c04
Closes-Bug: #1761781
(cherry picked from commit e9eca74e8366667fd0c26e47368e1092fee4590a)

commit_message:
Move serial console to environment.d

Allow other elements to set the serial console if necessary, since it
may not always reside on the defaults provided such as ttyS0.

Change-Id: Ia1b29e663e202eddf55c37a37260e7f2ae4edf14

subject: Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in rabbitmq for FedRAMP compliance
messages:
[{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-06-06 08:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-06-12 14:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-06-14 13:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-06-15 05:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-15 17:00:19.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

we have gate problems again, please do not restore or recheck, I'll take care of this one when gate is back stable."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-16 05:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 07:30:53.000000000', 'message': "Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in rabbitmq for FedRAMP compliance

Only allow TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 when connecting to the AMQP port over SSL.

We cannot disable a specific protocol version for inter node communication,
so in order to enforce TLS1.1 or greater, we disallow all ciphers provided
by SSLv2 SSLv3 and TLS1.0.

Node: The list of allowed ciphers cannot be specified with the usual
OpenSSL cipher list format, so we pass the list of ciphers which are
available out of the default cipher list [1] used for other services like
HAProxy, stunnel or mysql/galera. The list is precomputed with:

openssl ciphers -v {cipher_list_format} | cut -d' ' -f 1 | paste -sd :

[1] !SSLv2:kEECDH:kRSA:kEDH:kPSK:+3DES:!aNULL:!eNULL:!MD5:!EXP:!RC4:!SEED:!IDEA:!DES:!SSLv3:!TLSv1

Change-Id: I354d5851345033a90b43e6be9a6039cb4edca203
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
(cherry picked from commit 855a5a511dec81dd1cd79af2a176135b700ddeb9)
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in rabbitmq for FedRAMP compliance

Only allow TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 when connecting to the AMQP port over SSL.

We cannot disable a specific protocol version for inter node communication,
so in order to enforce TLS1.1 or greater, we disallow all ciphers provided
by SSLv2 SSLv3 and TLS1.0.

Node: The list of allowed ciphers cannot be specified with the usual
OpenSSL cipher list format, so we pass the list of ciphers which are
available out of the default cipher list [1] used for other services like
HAProxy, stunnel or mysql/galera. The list is precomputed with:

openssl ciphers -v {cipher_list_format} | cut -d' ' -f 1 | paste -sd :

[1] !SSLv2:kEECDH:kRSA:kEDH:kPSK:+3DES:!aNULL:!eNULL:!MD5:!EXP:!RC4:!SEED:!IDEA:!DES:!SSLv3:!TLSv1

Change-Id: I354d5851345033a90b43e6be9a6039cb4edca203
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
(cherry picked from commit 855a5a511dec81dd1cd79af2a176135b700ddeb9)

commit_message:
Print a more informative error message on misconfigured volumes

When making a mistake in the volumes configuration the error message
thrown to the operator is something like the following:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File \"/var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.py\", line 394, in <module>
        config_volumes = match_config_volumes(config_volume_prefix, v)
      File \"/var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.py\", line 89, in match_config_volumes
        volumes = config.get('volumes', [])
    AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'get'

Let's at least log *which* container had the failure.

Change-Id: I37af67a52f12d8a5d643b03c6796a07b23d47ab5

commit_message:
Unset UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages on converge.

There is an option to remove package, if the service is being
disabled during upgrade. This option should be unset when running
'overcloud upgrade converge'.

Change-Id: I7bad96be0c3dfc1e605efe9d504249dc9045d71d
(cherry picked from commit 5df1d9d90465321338037f148ad13f735dfe3122)

commit_message:
kolla_builder: use any templates except puppet

We have more and more services that use containers now, and not only
OpenShift, k8s. We now have Skydive and probably more services in
extraconfig/services that will come in the future.

This patch will use all but puppet templates to determines where are the
containers that we want to prepare with kolla.

Change-Id: I16a9e8533ba8cf1553ccac8c43f7556a71bd5b15

commit_message:
Dependency Mixin: permit null value to be resolved

This PS udpate the dependency mixin function to permit cases where
the mixin is disabled by passing a null value as the key to use
for resolution.

Change-Id: Idcade7eebed317852b70392431ed02a352241c9b
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: Neutron: run agents as bash child processes
messages:
[{'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-09 00:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-09 06:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

are you sure? as far as I know, bash is not considered as a good init process for the possibility that its child processes might be terminated not cleanly. I have to catch up with the recent status of sharing pid namespace in k8s but using "pause" as init process looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-09 16:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-10 11:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> are you sure? as far as I know, bash is not considered as a good
 > init process for the possibility that its child processes might be
 > terminated not cleanly. I have to catch up with the recent status
 > of sharing pid namespace in k8s but using "pause" as init process
 > looks good to me.

It's not good, but its much better than what we have today (nothing), if you could address this in a cleaner way it would be really apprecated.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-03-10 12:04:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-10 13:09:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

I'm gonna tidy this up a bit, and cleanly shutdown the processes."}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-10 13:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-03-10 22:39:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-03-12 01:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > are you sure? as far as I know, bash is not considered as a good
 > > init process for the possibility that its child processes might
 > be
 > > terminated not cleanly. I have to catch up with the recent status

 > > looks good to me.

 > It's not good, but its much better than what we have today
 > (nothing), if you could address this in a cleaner way it would be

sure, I'll look at it.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-12 02:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > > are you sure? as far as I know, bash is not considered as a
 > good
 > > > init process for the possibility that its child processes might
 > > be
 > > > terminated not cleanly. I have to catch up with the recent
 > status
 > > > of sharing pid namespace in k8s but using "pause" as init
 > process
 > > > looks good to me.
 > >
 > > It's not good, but its much better than what we have today
 > > (nothing), if you could address this in a cleaner way it would be
 > > really apprecated.
 > 
 > sure, I'll look at it.

hey - I looked into this a bit as well - and have found two paths forward:

1) we just run the services in the host pid namespace, and let the hosts init system do its thing.

2) we  use a lifcycle hook to cleanly terminate the process

I could implement either pretty quick in this ps - any preference for which way we go?'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-12 03:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-12 03:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-03-12 04:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> > > > are you sure? as far as I know, bash is not considered as a
 > > good
 > > > > init process for the possibility that its child processes
 > might
 > > > be
 > > > > terminated not cleanly. I have to catch up with the recent
 > > status
 > > > > of sharing pid namespace in k8s but using "pause" as init
 > > process
 > > > > looks good to me.
 > > >
 > > > It's not good, but its much better than what we have today
 > > > (nothing), if you could address this in a cleaner way it would
 > be
 > > > really apprecated.
 > >
 > > sure, I'll look at it.
 > 
 > hey - I looked into this a bit as well - and have found two paths
 > forward:
 > 
 > 1) we just run the services in the host pid namespace, and let the
 > hosts init system do its thing.
 > 
 > 2) we  use a lifcycle hook to cleanly terminate the process
 > 
 > I could implement either pretty quick in this ps - any preference
 > for which way we go?

great. I personally prefer using host pid namespace for now - for the first release. We could consider per-pod configuration of PID namespace sharing later as the feature is merged to k8s recently.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-03-13 05:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

why you prefer lifecycle hook? pid namespace sharing is made for handling exactly the same issue we‚Äôre having - zombie process. when k8s 1.10 is released, with support of pid namespace sharing, we could do something like below.

{{ if ge .Capabilities.KubeVersion.Minor ‚Äú10‚Äù }}
shareProcessNamespace: true
{{ else }}
hostPID: true
{{ end }}

anyway, current patch set should work as well. so, it‚Äôs up to you.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-06-16 19:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> why you prefer lifecycle hook? pid namespace sharing is made for
 > handling exactly the same issue we‚Äôre having - zombie process. when
 > k8s 1.10 is released, with support of pid namespace sharing, we
 > could do something like below.
 > 
 > {{ if ge .Capabilities.KubeVersion.Minor ‚Äú10‚Äù }}
 > shareProcessNamespace: true
 > {{ else }}
 > hostPID: true
 > {{ end }}
 > 
 > anyway, current patch set should work as well. so, it‚Äôs up to you.

This is cleaner, implemented in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575924/, thanks Hyunsun.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-06-16 19:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Neutron: run agents as bash child processes

This PS moves the neutron agents to run as child processes of bash
to prevent defunct process sprawl.

Change-Id: I2c6bda226db2b45b448ca5cd4d7e507cb06adab5

[{'created': '2018-05-16 21:54:40.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce placement minimum in nova.cmd.status

We keep forgetting to bump the minimum required placement version in
nova.cmd.status (and all the related bits and pieces) whenever we
change the report client to require a new version.

This patch interposes a check in the test_report_client functional suite
any time get/put/post/delete is called from the report client.  If we
see a microversion higher than the minumum specified in nova.cmd.status,
we raise an exception, which will blow up the test.  This should force
the author of a new patch on SchedulerReportClient to do the necessary
paperwork in that patch.

...assuming said author happens to write a test in test_report_client.
This pattern can and should be copied into other test suites where
report client tests are likely to be written, to broaden the scope of
this enforcement.

Change-Id: I5482b92f941261ab6ee6b7cd532ce268c31fe793

commit_message:
Enforce placement minimum in nova.cmd.status

We keep forgetting to bump the minimum required placement version in
nova.cmd.status (and all the related bits and pieces) whenever we
change the report client to require a new version.

This patch interposes a check in the test_report_client functional suite
any time get/put/post/delete is called from the report client.  If we
see a microversion higher than the minumum specified in nova.cmd.status,
we raise an exception, which will blow up the test.  This should force
the author of a new patch on SchedulerReportClient to do the necessary
paperwork in that patch.

...assuming said author happens to write a test in test_report_client.
This pattern can and should be copied into other test suites where
report client tests are likely to be written, to broaden the scope of
this enforcement.

Change-Id: I5482b92f941261ab6ee6b7cd532ce268c31fe793

commit_message:
fix the check-python-release role

The instructions for setting up the virtualenv were wrong, leading to
it being unusable. This patch fixes the setup and adds a variable to
control the location of the virtualenv, to mirror the way
ensure-sphinx and some of our other roles work.

Change-Id: I2d8d443ec1fb51d58e70ca0b7837e8ccf586513c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 19:14:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure that we have usable input for graphical console

Graphical console is optional thing. But when it is enabled then it is
good to have some input devices.

On x86(-64) it is handled by PS/2 keyboard/mouse. On ppc64 we have USB
keyboard/mouse. On aarch64 we have nothing.

So make sure that we have USB Host controller available and that usb
keyboard is present. Also USB tablet (default pointer_model device) will
have a port to plug to.

Closes-bug: 1745340

Change-Id: I69a934d188446a1aa95ab33975dbe1d6e058ebf9
(cherry picked from commit b92e3bc95fd69759031b7439b7f8392926910cc2)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure that we have usable input for graphical console

Graphical console is optional thing. But when it is enabled then it is
good to have some input devices.

On x86(-64) it is handled by PS/2 keyboard/mouse. On ppc64 we have USB
keyboard/mouse. On aarch64 we have nothing.

So make sure that we have USB Host controller available and that usb
keyboard is present. Also USB tablet (default pointer_model device) will
have a port to plug to.

Closes-bug: 1745340

Change-Id: I69a934d188446a1aa95ab33975dbe1d6e058ebf9
(cherry picked from commit b92e3bc95fd69759031b7439b7f8392926910cc2)

[{'account_id': 28492, 'date': '2018-06-16 15:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-16 15:47:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-06-16 16:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-16 17:59:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Wow, that's a really good catch, nice job Jean-David :)"}]

commit_message:
Correct systemd-networkd setup for static routes

Change Source into Destination to have defined static route applying on
the right CIDR and not 0.0.0.0

Change-Id: Id51ece1c72474de07dbf6cf740ecf4f93b2d1adf
Closes-Bug: #1777251

commit_message:
Fix yum contentdir var for non altarch

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568701/ created
contentdir file, but it's not working where file is not
present.
This patch fixes it for non altarch when file: contentdir
is not present on host.

Also change the fact name to yum_contentdir_data as
yum_contentdir conflicts with the when condition.

Change-Id: I99c095ab0da0cf969f0b7a1b3af890cc89c65454

commit_message:
Add logging for the original message

On port binding/unbinding, Kuryr catches exception raised from
pyroute2 and re-raise a new exception. As a result, the detailed
information contained in the original exception loses. This patch
adds a logging to record the original exception message and trace.

Related-Bug: #1776035
Change-Id: I4b13724a460d84a2b953f750b8b88c0f60cee97d

Does this align with the remaining pacemaker bundles updating?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-08 09:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Does this align with the remaining pacemaker bundles updating?

I hope it does. In other pacemaker bundle resources, "update_tasks" is straight forward, because when the stack is deployed, the images are tagged with pcmklatest and used when creating the bundle resources.

In the case of ovn queens deployment, we are not tagging the ovn-dbs-bundle image with pcmklatest tag. So when the stack update is run, this patch checks if the tag is present or not. If not present it first creates the tag, updates the ovn-dbs-bundle resource with image=ovn-northd:pcmklatest (in step 0 and 1). These steps will not be run for subsequent updates.

But in my testing I see that by step 1, pacemaker service is not running.

@Michele - during stack update, when is the pacemaker service stopped ?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-08 13:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-06-08 14:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-06-07 19:05:38.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add update_tasks to the OVN dbs pacemaker service

Presently the OVN dbs pacemaker service file doesn't include
the update_tasks section and it neither tags the docker image to
be used with pcmklatest. Because of which when a minor update is run,
the latest docker image for ovn-dbs-bundle is never pulled.

This patch addresses the first issue. i.e it adds update_tasks section.
It adds the tasks to detect if the image is tagged with pcmklatest. If not
it first tags it and then updates the pacemaker ovn-dbs-bundle resource.

For fresh deployments we still need to tag the image with pcmklatest. It is
done in another patch so that we can test the first issue in CI.

(TODO: Add the necessary steps in upgrade_tasks section)
Change-Id: Idbda3bedff57376b74269ab3470d2324b804ffd4
Partial-bug: #1775686
"}, {'created': '2018-06-08 13:50:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add update_tasks to the OVN dbs pacemaker service

be used with pcmklatest. Because of which when a minor update is run,
the latest docker image for ovn-dbs-bundle is never pulled.

This patch addresses the first issue. i.e it adds update_tasks section.
It adds the tasks to detect if the image is tagged with pcmklatest. If not
it first tags it and then updates the pacemaker ovn-dbs-bundle resource.

This patch also adds the required taks in "upgrade_tasks" section.

For fresh deployments we still need to tag the image with pcmklatest. It is
done in another patch so that we can test the first issue in CI.

Change-Id: Idbda3bedff57376b74269ab3470d2324b804ffd4
Partial-bug: #1775686
'}, {'created': '2018-06-09 06:30:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing 'update_tasks' to the OVN dbs pacemaker service

ovn-dbs-bundle is never pulled.

This patch addresses these issue. It does 3 things

It adds additional few steps in step 5 (which is not the case with other

commit_message:
Add missing 'update_tasks' to the OVN dbs pacemaker service

Presently the OVN dbs pacemaker service file doesn't include the update_tasks
section and it neither tags the docker image to be used with pcmklatest.
Because of which when a minor update is run, the latest docker image for
ovn-dbs-bundle is never pulled.

This patch addresses these issue. It does 3 things

1. It adds update_tasks section similar to other pacemaker bundle services.
It adds additional few steps in step 5 (which is not the case with other
pacemaker bundle services) to update the ovn bundle service to use the
image tagged with pcmklatest if it not yet using. These additional steps
are required for OVN deployments deployed before this patch and wants to
do a minor stack update.

2. It adds the required tasks in "upgrade_tasks" section similar to
other pacemaker bundle services.

3. Adds docker_config step to tag the image with pcmklatest tag.

Change-Id: Idbda3bedff57376b74269ab3470d2324b804ffd4
Closes-bug: #1775686

commit_message:
Daemonsets/Deployments: Use current kubernetes api version

This PS moves to use the current ga version for kubernetes daemonsets,
additionally any remaining deployments that were using the
`extensions/v1beta1` have been updated to `apps/v1`.

Story: 2002205
Task: 21735
Depends-On: If9703162dc472af1e6096bf2b9062802fd5ce8ab

Change-Id: Iba4e3d2798c54639e077b80999e669c79b616c6f
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

When the create_overcloudrc workflow was first introduced, it did
not provide an input argument for the no_proxy argument of the
primary action it calls.  This patch adds the no_proxy input argument
to the create_overcloudrc workflow, ensures the argument is passed
to the underlying action and updates the description of the workflow
to notify users of the optional no_proxy list.

fixes-bug: 1776930
'}]
commit_message:
Adds no_proxy input to create_overcloudrc workflow

When the create_overcloudrc workflow was first introduced, it did
not provide an input argument for the no_proxy argument of the
primary action it calls.  This patch adds the no_proxy input argument
to the create_overcloudrc workflow, ensures the argument is passed
to the underlying action and updates the description of the workflow
to notify users of the optional no_proxy list.

Change-Id: I6074b4085b5b77f010f5f2972e7b120aa344f6c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 13:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fail_if_empty invocation with pipes

* Since $@ parameter may have pipe '|' it should be processed correctly.
  Currenly the part before pipe is assigned as $@ so bash runs pipe with
  commands after it after execution of function. However, we want to assign
  command with pipe to $@ thus "" around command with pipe are required.
* replace $() with eval as $() doesn't work correctly with pipe as it tries to
  escape pipe so output variable contains wrong data.
* This patch adds tonumber to first invocation

Change-Id: I958e14c0a4ea4b5782d2c74dc895471b0f70b875
(cherry picked from commit 9a37e5ac42cf6d3c26ffec88851860a4c33351a3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fail_if_empty invocation with pipes

* Since $@ parameter may have pipe '|' it should be processed correctly.
  Currenly the part before pipe is assigned as $@ so bash runs pipe with
  commands after it after execution of function. However, we want to assign
  command with pipe to $@ thus "" around command with pipe are required.
* replace $() with eval as $() doesn't work correctly with pipe as it tries to
  escape pipe so output variable contains wrong data.
* This patch adds tonumber to first invocation

Change-Id: I958e14c0a4ea4b5782d2c74dc895471b0f70b875
(cherry picked from commit 9a37e5ac42cf6d3c26ffec88851860a4c33351a3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 13:29:42.000000000', 'message': "Introduce wait_backoff, fail_if_empty wrappers

* wait_backoff wrapper retries the command several time increasing backoff
  timeout exponentially. Its log is added to to stderr.

* Under some circumstances (race condition), stack may be created but it's
  resources are not. fail_if_empty wrapper fails if no output received.

* Some openstack commands were wrapped as there is a delay between stack and
  resource creations. Usually it's not visible on speedy environments. However,
  when undercloud is located on small VM or cloud flavour is m1.medium then a
  race condition may occur as heat creates stack and its resources
  sequentially. This means there may be cases when stack is created but its
  resources are not. Wrapping openstack calls with wait_backoff and
  fail_if_empty guarantees output with proper exit code

Change-Id: If10f4d58f3689bc7d817c8ac2c31e48501e937ce
(cherry picked from commit fc06a7debac60e5066aa31bbfccef573618930a1)
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce wait_backoff, fail_if_empty wrappers

* wait_backoff wrapper retries the command several time increasing backoff
  timeout exponentially. Its log is added to to stderr.

* Under some circumstances (race condition), stack may be created but it's
  resources are not. fail_if_empty wrapper fails if no output received.

* Some openstack commands were wrapped as there is a delay between stack and
  resource creations. Usually it's not visible on speedy environments. However,
  when undercloud is located on small VM or cloud flavour is m1.medium then a
  race condition may occur as heat creates stack and its resources
  sequentially. This means there may be cases when stack is created but its
  resources are not. Wrapping openstack calls with wait_backoff and
  fail_if_empty guarantees output with proper exit code

Change-Id: If10f4d58f3689bc7d817c8ac2c31e48501e937ce
(cherry picked from commit fc06a7debac60e5066aa31bbfccef573618930a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 13:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'get-occ-config.sh: fix handling multiple nodes in a role

When using get-occ-config.sh with a role with a count greater
than 1, the script will now configure all nodes that are of that role
type instead of exiting after only configuring the first.

Previously, the expression ((i++)) evaluated to 0, and when using
arithmetic expansion, causes a rc of 1, which caused the script to exit
after configuring the first node.

Change-Id: I0a39f2b8f1de5302fd426999acfe5043b0361987
Closes-Bug: #1759581
(cherry picked from commit 154879b68dfe3ff3834babcfb1d619a4d05044af)
'}]
commit_message:
get-occ-config.sh: fix handling multiple nodes in a role

When using get-occ-config.sh with a role with a count greater
than 1, the script will now configure all nodes that are of that role
type instead of exiting after only configuring the first.

Previously, the expression ((i++)) evaluated to 0, and when using
arithmetic expansion, causes a rc of 1, which caused the script to exit
after configuring the first node.

Change-Id: I0a39f2b8f1de5302fd426999acfe5043b0361987
Closes-Bug: #1759581
(cherry picked from commit 154879b68dfe3ff3834babcfb1d619a4d05044af)

commit_message:
Match only haproxy for docker ps and skipp all *-haproxy occurences

The grep regexp can match several lines if the haproxy pattern
is present.
By matching only the started by a whitespace it will match
the haproxy container listed by docker ps:
[...] Up 17 hours   neutron-haproxy-qrouter
[...] Up 20 hours   haproxy-bundle-docker-

Cherry-pick from: a472f7d513261cffbecfe71cb6b39b3256eb4ae4
Resolves: rhbz#1585605

Change-Id: Id63991e862ab10170c8afbde7a11677cc3d2e2f6

commit_message:
Add packages to bindep.txt for infra support

Updated bindep.txt for infra to add:
  * memcached
  * keepalived
  * haproxy
  * rabbitmq

Also applied a sort to bindep.txt

Change-Id: Ie21dcbf5cd17a5a9407c5e5604d57cfcbd96f7f9

commit_message:
Improve kata-runsh job

Add system package dependencies (build-essential, golang-1.10) and
set GOPATH to $HOME for the zuul user which should magically work with
the zuul git repo pathing. Additionally use shell with set -x.

We switch to xenial so that we can use upstream docker-ce packages which
the kata ci seems to expect.

Depends-On: Ief0f20c2f1b42a5c23ed05f7185c58700f65b06e
Change-Id: Ibb5cee5ba90662e53c39dcf686a52bcafe81c933

commit_message:
Delete messages container on plan deletion

The new config-download workflow creates a XXX-messages swift container
to persist the zaqar messages for the UI to consume. We should delete
the container when the plan is removed.

Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows
Change-Id: Iff21b810faafad2a0920bf1e7218c39270b7ab88

Use infra-root-keys-2018-06-15 in nodepool

The new keypair object has the updated set of ssh keys. Once the new
object is in the clouds we can consume it for nodes.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 18:02:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove confusing deprecation message

regarding proxified db model properties.

When share instances were introduced a number of fields
were moved in the database model to the underlying share instance
and proxied back to the share in order to maintain compatability
with APIs that assume these to belong to the share.  A deprecation
warning was added for these.  The warning spams the API log and
confuses end users because it sounds like they or their client
should make a change to get rid of them and that cannot actually
be done.  The API would have to change to expose share instances
to end users rather than just administrators and that is not
something that we plan to do.

Remove these confusing warnings.

Closes-Bug: #1776947

Change-Id: I95e99b26f416bbf25cfd1c8f7295f3ba6220efb3

commit_message:
Remove confusing DB deprecation messages

When share instances were introduced a number of fields
were moved in the database model to the underlying share instance
and proxied back to the share in order to maintain compatability
with APIs that assume these to belong to the share.  A deprecation
warning was added for these.  The warning spams the API log and
confuses end users because it sounds like they or their client
should make a change to get rid of them and that cannot actually
be done.  The API would have to change to expose share instances
to end users rather than just administrators and that is not
something that we plan to do.

Remove these confusing warnings.

Closes-Bug: #1776947

Change-Id: I95e99b26f416bbf25cfd1c8f7295f3ba6220efb3

commit_message:
Use oslo.messaging per-call monitoring

This change makes nova configure oslo.messaging's active call monitoring
feature if the operator increases the rpc_response_timeout configuration
option beyond the default of 60 seconds. If this happens, oslo.messaging will
heartbeat actively-running calls to indicate that they are still running,
avoiding a false timeout at the shorter interval, while still detecting
actual dead-service failures before the longer timeout value.

In addition, this adds a long_rpc_timeout configuration option that we
can use for known-to-run-long operations separately from the base
rpc_response_timeout value, and pre_live_migration() is changed to use
this, as it is known to suffer from early false timeouts.

Depends-On: Iecb7bef61b3b8145126ead1f74dbaadd7d97b407
Change-Id: Icb0bdc6d4ce4524341e70e737eafcb25f346d197

commit_message:
Use user specified private key when deleting temp keys

We use the user specified private key when we inject the temporary ssh
key, and we should also use it when we delete the temprorary ssh keys.
Even though this script is no longer used on master, we should commit
this so we can backport to queens.

Change-Id: Id389984b87209f959e4cf439abd8165a3a08ead3
Closes-Bug: #1773980
(cherry picked from commit d04e7ea4f3fce0c787c3eed6f1840b402435113c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 13:45:54.000000000', 'message': 'Update the disk_cachemodes to mention an rbd detail

The disk_cachemodes text for the writeback mode explains the danger
inherent with providing writeback cache semantics to the guest where
the host page cache is involved. The qemu-native RBD driver provides
correct flush behavior to the RBD cache on the host, and thus is
safe to use (and recommended by the upstream Ceph documentation).

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rbd/qemu-rbd/#qemu-cache-options

Change-Id: I975a6544484bc8d5f062e99f85374710295443c7
'}]
commit_message:
Update the disk_cachemodes to mention an rbd detail

The disk_cachemodes text for the writeback mode explains the danger
inherent with providing writeback cache semantics to the guest where
the host page cache is involved. The qemu-native RBD driver provides
correct flush behavior to the RBD cache on the host, and thus is
safe to use (and recommended by the upstream Ceph documentation).

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rbd/qemu-rbd/#qemu-cache-options

Change-Id: I975a6544484bc8d5f062e99f85374710295443c7

commit_message:
Add timestamps to update log files

In order for logstash indexing to function, logfiles need timestamps

This commit "updates the update logs" to be consistent with other
logs collected by CI. Note that the timestamper_cmd has an embedded "|"

Related Change (upgrade logging):

- https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/?id=baff4a25229b1904e960e426208eca76c96c3ab4

Change-Id: I47b6ff912aa045c266b903fa148b068be653cae2
(cherry picked from commit b254e04226cc11410e11b7bccf322f4703dfb1c9)

commit_message:
Remove max_size parameter from fake_libvirt_utils.fetch_*image methods

The max_size parameter was removed from the real libvirt utils
fetch_*image methods in change I70a559f3dc9b59097ff6923920f4377cca00d1b2
but missed fake_libvirt_utils.

Change-Id: I2bbaf48b031ae6598d184e6c5675862bfebb95f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 21:07:11.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: added boot mode support to ManagementInterface

This change introduces boot mode support to driver
management interface.

The management interface is called at deploy time to
synchronize BM machine boot node setting to Ironic
node configuration whenever needed.

Change-Id: If3db6ab8d3fae35d17808a231b7eecf11cf58327
'}, {'created': '2017-12-11 18:44:38.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: added boot mode support to ManagementInterface

This change introduces boot mode get/set methods to
driver management interface alongside existing
get/set boot device calls.

The management interface is called at deploy time to
synchronize BM machine boot node setting to Ironic
node configuration whenever needed.

To keep the patch smaller, this change does not include:

* the exposure of the boot mode configuration through
  Ironic REST API / RPC.
* setting boot mode to the BM node from Ironic
  configuration

These features will be addressed by the followup patches.

Change-Id: If3db6ab8d3fae35d17808a231b7eecf11cf58327

'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 12:13:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add boot mode support to ManagementInterface

This change introduces optional boot mode get/set methods
to driver management interface [1] alongside existing
get/set boot device calls.

The management interface is called at deploy time to
synchronize BM machine boot mode setting with Ironic
node configuration whenever needed.

Also, this change introduces common exception class to
be eventually used by the drivers to communicate their
runtime errors to Ironic code in a uniformed way.

To keep the patch smaller, this change does not include:

* exposure of the boot mode configuration through
  Ironic REST API / RPC.

The above feature will be addressed by the followup patches.

1. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2018-01-09.log.html

Change-Id: If3db6ab8d3fae35d17808a231b7eecf11cf58327

'}, {'created': '2018-03-27 09:56:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add boot mode support to ManagementInterface

This change introduces optional boot mode get/set methods
to driver management interface [1] alongside existing
get/set boot device calls.

The management interface is called at deploy time to
synchronize BM machine boot mode setting with Ironic
node configuration whenever needed.

Also, this change introduces common exception class to
be eventually used by the drivers to communicate their
runtime errors to Ironic code in a uniformed way.

To keep the patch smaller, this change does not include:

* exposure of the boot mode configuration through
  Ironic REST API / RPC.

The above feature will be addressed by the followup patches.

commit_message:
Adds boot mode support to ManagementInterface

This change introduces optional boot mode get/set methods
to driver management interface [1] [2] alongside existing
get/set boot device calls.

The management interface is called at deploy time to
synchronize BM machine boot mode setting with Ironic
node configuration whenever needed.

Also, this change introduces common exception class to
be eventually used by the drivers to communicate their
runtime errors to Ironic code in a uniformed way.

1. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2018-01-09.log.html#t2018-01-09T15:54:16
2. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2018-05-11.log.html#t2018-05-11T12:47:12

Story: 1734131
Task: 10640
Change-Id: If3db6ab8d3fae35d17808a231b7eecf11cf58327

commit_message:
Use correct variable for sso_callback_template deployment

The sso_callback_template file needs to be deployed for a
Keystone SP, not IDP. This patch fixes the conditional.

Closes-Bug: #1772772
Change-Id: I420e291807434382b4d3cd4c8809c7540a419f5a
(cherry picked from commit f88841f37ff6293b6913d1e16d864703c2a080c6)

commit_message:
Add PLACEMENT_DB_ENABLED=True to the nova-next job

This will configure [placement_database]/connection to its
own database.

The depends on is to a devstack fix which changes the ordering of
database creation in devstack to ensure the placement database exists
before something tries to sync it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/564180
Change-Id: I896cd77d1ce793dddbd68a8dd8dcf04c1ab38f2d

commit_message:
scen007 is failing in the gate

Moving to non-voting until the gate is green
RDO-Cloud is down and we can not fix the
dist-git.

Related-Bug: #1777168

Change-Id: I6112854ced3c20705665020646535ea39ec43133

commit_message:
Add dry run option to toci_quickstart - playbook order in tact

With dry run, playbooks are not executed.
The env variables, releases script output and playbooks
commands are written out to files for debug.

The review also moves the collect logs lines to a
function for easier organization

Documentation for the dry run option and variable
files is added.

Change-Id: I0bad5ee3150d94115bed018de9488590305a2b80

commit_message:
enable the update job on scripts/* changes

The tripleo-common/scripts dir has some critical
pieces of the deployment and update/upgrade it
may make sense to trigger the update job on changes.

Change-Id: I57b556454ab3207bb22f26e8e09f6a951d4161c9

commit_message:
Use role tripleo-modify-image to update containers

This change uses the yum_update task file in ansible role
tripleo-modify-image to update the undercloud images.

Change-Id: I62a4b03538d26083a0ba4ce0b2e7a5b0c456134d
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 02:41:31.000000000', 'message': 'Use the in-built image prepare for undercloud install

This file will write out the heat environment file
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml which will be used during undercloud
install to do any required image preparation during undercloud
install.

The role parameter undercloud_container_images_file has been left as
an option for overriding, but is no longer required.

It is expected that overcloud deploy will use the exact same
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml and the logic will be in place to
skip any unnecessary prepare actions. For this reason, the parameter
undercloud_docker_image_tag has been removed, and docker_image_tag is
used directly.

Change-Id: I290806b9296773688dfd02bc41f8baea28cf3d6a
Depends-On: I7449ee364ec9e976fbe9df95024ce3c42f6459b5

'}, {'created': '2018-06-14 00:05:55.000000000', 'message': 'Use the in-built image prepare for undercloud install

This file will write out the heat environment file
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml which will be used to do any
required image preparation during undercloud install.

The role parameter undercloud_container_images_file has been left as
an option for overriding, but is no longer required.

This change also switches the overcloud prepare to consume this file
via the command "openstack tripleo container image prepare"

It is expected that overcloud deploy will use the exact same
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml and the logic will be in place to
skip any unnecessary prepare actions. For this reason, the parameter

commit_message:
Use the in-built image prepare for undercloud install

This file will write out the heat environment file
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml which will be used to do any
required image preparation during undercloud install.

The role parameter undercloud_container_images_file has been left as
an option for overriding, but is no longer required.

This change also switches the overcloud prepare to consume this file
via the command "openstack tripleo container image prepare"

It is expected that overcloud deploy will use the exact same
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml and the logic will be in place to
skip any unnecessary prepare actions. For this reason, the parameter
undercloud_docker_image_tag has been removed, and docker_image_tag is
used directly.
Since this file (and the variables used to build it) will be common to
undercloud and overcloud, there has been some refactoring to move
variable defaults to extras-common.

Change-Id: I290806b9296773688dfd02bc41f8baea28cf3d6a
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Correct community beats index

Community beats sometimes lack all of the assumed metadata that a core
beat would contain by default. This change will check if a beat has the
version metadata before assuming it does, which is commonly not found on
community beats (journalbeat).

Change-Id: I64adf5ff7c810a593b9fc2d0f306cfd4bda6632d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
